name: redux-loop
description: Sequence your effects naturally and purely by returning them from your reducers.

scripts.build:umd: cross-env BABEL_ENV=es NODE_ENV=development rollup -c -i src/index.js -o dist/redux-loop.js
scripts.build:umd:min: cross-env BABEL_ENV=es NODE_ENV=production rollup -c -i src/index.js -o dist/redux-loop.min.js
scripts.build:flow: ncp flow-typed/redux-loop_v5.x.x.js lib/index.flow.js && ncp flow-typed/redux-loop_v5.x.x.js dist/index.flow.js && ncp flow-typed/redux-loop_v5.x.x.js es/index.flow.js
scripts.build: yarn build:commonjs && yarn build:es && yarn build:umd && yarn build:umd:min && yarn build:flow
scripts.prepublishOnly: yarn lint && yarn test && yarn build
scripts.docs:build: yarn run docs:prepare && gitbook build -g redux-loop/redux-loop && cp logo/logo.png _book/gitbook/images/logo.png && cp logo/favicon.ico _book/gitbook/images
scripts.docs:publish: yarn run docs:clean && yarn run docs:build && cp CNAME _book && cd _book && git init && git commit --allow-empty -m 'update book' && git checkout -b gh-pages && touch .nojekyll && git add . && git commit -am 'update book' && git push git@github.com:redux-loop/redux-loop gh-pages --force

author: Luke William Westby <luke.westby@raise.com>
